verses.niv: 23 Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord, not for men,
verses.kjv: 23 And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men;
verses.esv: 23 Whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord and not for men,

verses.niv: 3 Commit to the LORD whatever you do, and your plans will succeed.
verses.kjv: 3 Commit thy works unto the LORD, and thy thoughts shall be established.
verses.esv:
3   Commit your work to the LORD,
    and your plans will be established.

verses.niv: 31 So whether you eat or drink or whatever you do, do it all for the glory of God.
verses.kjv: 31 Whether therefore ye eat, or drink, or whatsoever ye do, do all to the glory of God.
verses.esv: 31 So, whether you eat or drink, or whatever you do, do all to the glory of God.

verses.niv: 9 One who is slack in his work is brother to one who destroys.
verses.kjv: 9 He also that is slothful in his work is brother to him that is a great waster.
verses.esv:
9   Whoever is slack in his work
    is a brother to him who destroys.

verses.niv: 15 The LORD God took the man and put him in the Garden of Eden to work it and take care of it.
verses.kjv: 15 And the LORD God took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden to dress it and to keep it.
verses.esv: 15 The LORD God took the man and put him in the garden of Eden to work it and keep it.

verses.niv: 28 He who has been stealing must steal no longer, but must work, doing something useful with his own hands, that he may have something to share with those in need.
verses.kjv: 28 Let him that stole steal no more: but rather let him labour, working with his hands the thing which is good, that he may have to give to him that needeth.
verses.esv: 28 Let the thief no longer steal, but rather let him labor, doing honest work with his own hands, so that he may have something to share with anyone in need.

verses.niv: 22 Slaves, obey your earthly masters in everything; and do it, not only when their eye is on you and to win their favor, but with sincerity of heart and reverence for the Lord. 23 Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord, not for men, 24 since you know that you will receive an inheritance from the Lord as a reward. It is the Lord Christ you are serving.
verses.kjv: 22 Servants, obey in all things your masters according to the flesh; not with eyeservice, as menpleasers; but in singleness of heart, fearing God: 23 And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men; 24 Knowing that of the Lord ye shall receive the reward of the inheritance: for ye serve the Lord Christ.
verses.esv: 22 Bondservants, obey in everything those who are your earthly masters, not by way of eye-service, as people-pleasers, but with sincerity of heart, fearing the Lord. 23 Whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord and not for men, 24 knowing that from the Lord you will receive the inheritance as your reward. You are serving the Lord Christ.

verses.niv: 10 For even when we were with you, we gave you this rule: "If a man will not work, he shall not eat."
verses.kjv: 10 For even when we were with you, this we commanded you, that if any would not work, neither should he eat.
verses.esv: 10 For even when we were with you, we would give you this command: If anyone is not willing to work, let him not eat.

verses.niv: 23 All hard work brings a profit, but mere talk leads only to poverty.
verses.kjv: 23 In all labour there is profit: but the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.
verses.esv:
23   In all toil there is profit,
    but mere talk tends only to poverty.

verses.niv: 37 For nothing is impossible with God."
verses.kjv: 37 For with God nothing shall be impossible.
verses.esv: 37 For nothing will be impossible with God.”

verses.niv: 27 Do not work for food that spoils, but for food that endures to eternal life, which the Son of Man will give you. On him God the Father has placed his seal of approval."
verses.kjv: 27 Labour not for the meat which perisheth, but for that meat which endureth unto everlasting life, which the Son of man shall give unto you: for him hath God the Father sealed.
verses.esv: 27 Do not work for the food that perishes, but for the food that endures to eternal life, which the Son of Man will give to you. For on him God the Father has set his seal.”

verses.niv: 10 But by the grace of God I am what I am, and his grace to me was not without effect. No, I worked harder than all of them--yet not I, but the grace of God that was with me.
verses.kjv: 10 But by the grace of God I am what I am: and his grace which was bestowed upon me was not in vain; but I laboured more abundantly than they all: yet not I, but the grace of God which was with me.
verses.esv: 10 But by the grace of God I am what I am, and his grace toward me was not in vain. On the contrary, I worked harder than any of them, though it was not I, but the grace of God that is with me.

verses.niv: 11 Make it your ambition to lead a quiet life, to mind your own business and to work with your hands, just as we told you,
verses.kjv: 11 And that ye study to be quiet, and to do your own business, and to work with your own hands, as we commanded you;
verses.esv: 11 and to aspire to live quietly, and to mind your own affairs, and to work with your hands, as we instructed you,

verses.niv: 10 Whatever your hand finds to do, do it with all your might, for in the grave, where you are going, there is neither working nor planning nor knowledge nor wisdom.
verses.kjv: 10 Whatsoever thy hand findeth to do, do it with thy might; for there is no work, nor device, nor knowledge, nor wisdom, in the grave, whither thou goest.
verses.esv: 10 Whatever your hand finds to do, do it with your might, for there is no work or thought or knowledge or wisdom in Sheol, to which you are going.

verses.niv: 14 Do everything in love.
verses.kjv: 14 Let all your things be done with charity.
verses.esv: 14 Let all that you do be done in love.

verses.niv: 5 The plans of the diligent lead to profit as surely as haste leads to poverty.
verses.kjv: 5 The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness; but of every one that is hasty only to want.
verses.esv:
5   The plans of the diligent lead surely to abundance,
    but everyone who is hasty comes only to poverty.

verses.niv: 4 Each one should test his own actions. Then he can take pride in himself, without comparing himself to somebody else, 5 for each one should carry his own load.
verses.kjv: 4 But let every man prove his own work, and then shall he have rejoicing in himself alone, and not in another. 5 For every man shall bear his own burden.
verses.esv: 4 But let each one test his own work, and then his reason to boast will be in himself alone and not in his neighbor. 5 For each will have to bear his own load.

verses.niv: 17 May the favor of the Lord our God rest upon us; establish the work of our hands for us- yes, establish the work of our hands.
verses.kjv: 17 And let the beauty of the LORD our God be upon us: and establish thou the work of our hands upon us; yea, the work of our hands establish thou it.
verses.esv:
17   Let the favor of the Lord our God be upon us,
    and establish the work of our hands upon us;
    yes, establish the work of our hands!

verses.niv: 28 "Come to me, all you who are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest.
verses.kjv: 28 Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.
verses.esv: 28 Come to me, all who labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.

verses.niv: 23 Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord, not for men, 24 since you know that you will receive an inheritance from the Lord as a reward. It is the Lord Christ you are serving. 25 Anyone who does wrong will be repaid for his wrong, and there is no favoritism.
verses.kjv: 23 And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men; 24 Knowing that of the Lord ye shall receive the reward of the inheritance: for ye serve the Lord Christ. 25 But he that doeth wrong shall receive for the wrong which he hath done: and there is no respect of persons.
verses.esv: 23 Whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord and not for men, 24 knowing that from the Lord you will receive the inheritance as your reward. You are serving the Lord Christ. 25 For the wrongdoer will be paid back for the wrong he has done, and there is no partiality.

verses.niv: 7 The rich rule over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender.
verses.kjv: 7 The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender.
verses.esv:
7   The rich rules over the poor,
    and the borrower is the slave of the lender.

verses.niv: 17 And whatever you do, whether in word or deed, do it all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him.
verses.kjv: 17 And whatsoever ye do in word or deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God and the Father by him.
verses.esv: 17 And whatever you do, in word or deed, do everything in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him.

verses.niv: 27 Finish your outdoor work and get your fields ready; after that, build your house.
verses.kjv: 27 Prepare thy work without, and make it fit for thyself in the field; and afterwards build thine house.
verses.esv:
27   Prepare your work outside;
    get everything ready for yourself in the field,
    and after that build your house.

verses.niv: 11 He who works his land will have abundant food, but he who chases fantasies lacks judgment.
verses.kjv: 11 He that tilleth his land shall be satisfied with bread: but he that followeth vain persons is void of understanding.
verses.esv:
11   Whoever works his land will have plenty of bread,
    but he who follows worthless pursuits lacks sense.

verses.niv: 30 I went past the field of the sluggard, past the vineyard of the man who lacks judgment; 31 thorns had come up everywhere, the ground was covered with weeds, and the stone wall was in ruins. 32 I applied my heart to what I observed and learned a lesson from what I saw: 33 A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest- 34 and poverty will come on you like a bandit and scarcity like an armed man.
verses.kjv: 30 I went by the field of the slothful, and by the vineyard of the man void of understanding; 31 And, lo, it was all grown over with thorns, and nettles had covered the face thereof, and the stone wall thereof was broken down. 32 Then I saw, and considered it well: I looked upon it, and received instruction. 33 Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep: 34 So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth; and thy want as an armed man.
verses.esv:
30   I passed by the field of a sluggard,
    by the vineyard of a man lacking sense,
31   and behold, it was all overgrown with thorns;
    the ground was covered with nettles,
    and its stone wall was broken down.
32   Then I saw and considered it;
    I looked and received instruction.
33   A little sleep, a little slumber,
    a little folding of the hands to rest,
34   and poverty will come upon you like a robber,
    and want like an armed man.
